Reviews.Title: “Very small room and bathroom with no space for 5. Very steep stairs dangerous for young children.”
Reviews.Author: Jean Paul B Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Very small room and bathroom with no space for 5. The breakfasr was "served" in a ridiculouslysml room where 25% of the customers of the hotel could hardly fit at the same time The breakfasr came down to toasts and coffee, which is an insult to the english breakfast in the english camital Very steep stairs dangerous for young children.Thé staff bevaves like tellers and has no value added to the customer's stay. Good location In london and tidy place.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: The breakfastroom is to small.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny but good position”
Reviews.Author: crislondon08
Reviews.Content: I had book a single room and yes I have to admit that the size was very much like a closet. The hotel though it's clean enough, breakfast room tiny and used to store luggage too but the location it's great! If you get a reasonable price it's OK. Ah they charge you to leave the luggage...not very good customer service, it should be for free even if it's not The Plaza!

Reviews.Title: “Charming hotel in Notting Hill”
Reviews.Author: Carina S Posted by an Easytobook.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Nice location, near underground and buses. Close to Portobello Road. Nice restaurants in the nearby area. Clean rooms, our room was very small but still ok for three The breakfastroom was very small and the breakfast was mediocere.

Reviews.Title: “RIP OFF!!! BE CAREFULL!”
Reviews.Author: wendy f
Reviews.Content: Tried to book this hotel with a debit card and was told very adamantly that they were unable to reserve a room for me with this type of card as they dont accept debit cards!!! - then to my astonishment they charged me (yes on the same card!) half the full price for not turning up! After reading other reviews, seems they can charge whenever they like for whatever they like even without your premission then refer you to some dodgy small print on their website!! Staff rude and accused me of lying when I tried to discuss the issue with them - stay away!

Reviews.Title: “Looks nice on the outside but paper thin walls and windows”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelbybike
Reviews.Content: I travel for work and need a place to relax at the end of the day and a quiet hotel. This was not my experience. 1st night - mid week, I stayed on the 3rd floor with a courtyard and it was quiet for the first 20 minutes until my neighbours came back and turned on their bathroom fan and left it on while they went out for 3 hours. Then they kept opening and shutting the fire doors and talking loudly. I was angry but knew there was nothing the hotel could do because of their lack of insulation in the walls. By 2 am the loud neighbours left and then by 5 am they were back turning on the bathroom fan. The next morning, I politely asked my neighbours were going to be back and if so could I please be moved. Sure enough, they claimed they did not hear the loud party and did not understand why I did not register a complaint. Ok so if I were to register a complaint, most likely they would not be able to stop the noise, esp. if they are renting their rooms to college age students. They kindly moved me and put me in the basement in a room facing the street with a single pained window so I could hear all the cars driving by, slamming their doors, and the click clack of people walking. I can hear my neighbours pacing their floor and slamming the doors even the fire door that squeaks open and shut. I hope to go for a run in Hyde Park before my long 10 hour day ... we shall see if I can pull off at least 4 hours of sleep.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE, INFURIATING!!! a 3 stars hotel??!!”
Reviews.Author: Abdelilah A
Reviews.Content: I've stayed in this hotel for 3 nights during 2012 eve and I payed 224 pounds, expensive for a single room. What to say; It was the worst experience I have ever had!!! thin rooms, strange smell, no lift, noisy, cannot sleep, lavatory inside shower, and the worst of all : I've found S-L-U-G-S many times in my room!!! (see the pictures) How this could happen in a "3 stars" hotel??? Who give this assessment??? even NO star is not acceptable, and I didn't talk about the very small breakfast room where you can't stand, and the content of their promised "continental" breakfast, very terrible!!! What a shame for London to have such hotels, I've been in many hotels around the world and really I've never ever seen this even in "Third World" hotels. Moreover, even after complaining many time (cause each night I found new SLUGS), NO SOLUTION. The manager (called "Ahmed" by phone) is never around physically and difficult to join by phone even if you ask many time the reception, the employed staff was very friendly and wanted to help but no solution: "We are complete, we suggest a room in an other hotel". Sound good... I went to the suggested hotel (which is financed by the same manager) and I discovered a very small room, smaller than the room #26!!! It is for rats not for humans. And the worst was the receptionist: coarse and threatening, UNBELIEVABLE!!! After this new very grueling experience, coming back to Notting Hill Gate hotel: Of course, no solution provided, as I have to stay in room #26 with SLUGS for an other night. The last night they finally changed it for an other room, it was the room #1. OK, can I breath and sleep?!... NO, it was in the basement, strange smell, very noisy, no WiFi signal, NO INTERNET ACCESS. I would prefer SLUGS in room #26?! It was an UNBELIEVABLE experience. How this 3 stars hotel could exist???!!!

Reviews.Title: “It is a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: haltaiar
Reviews.Content: I stayed for one night in this hotel. It offers a good value for money. My room was good. It is ideal for singles or couples.

Reviews.Title: “Apart from the position ... This should be completely review.”
Reviews.Author: Consultur
Reviews.Content: This should be a budget hotel for the poor quality of service offered, old rooms, small toilettes, old furnitures, old windows you cannot even close ... But I paid 100 pounds for a single use room. Hotel gave me a quad room but most probably because they did not have single rooms ... Breakfast is very very poor in a small room of 9 square meters, a continental breakfast very bad served ... Butter left on the tables with no ice, chees standing on a table to the air not protected from bacterial .. Receptionist are very kind and offers good service but I cannot promote this property at all. Price should be the half, breakfast should be reviewed and management should look better about many things like staff lefting cleaning products and instruments on the entrance to the bakfast room near the food! Location is good and easy to find just 300mt from Notting hill tube.

Reviews.Title: “Not a place to stay but very friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: marjan_k
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a dump, smells like sh.. And not at all a place to stay but in the other hand very very nice and friendly staff. They tried hard to make up for the hotel but ... Rooms are so bad you can hear next door person snoring, crap breakfast that I had to leave every morning and eat out.

Reviews.Title: “Better seek for something else.”
Reviews.Author: Mo2012
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for 1 night because I was attending an event in London. I have booked almost 3 weeks before arriving. The area is really nice and the hotel is located near the Notting Hill Tube station. That is I guess the only positive thing I can come up with. To stay in this hotel for 1 night is ok, but only when you check in, visit London and come back exhausted and directly fall asleep. Hotelstaff was ok, the reception is a tiny desk where the most of the time the guy is on the internet and minding his own business. I had a terrible small room, where I couldnt even open the door properly. On top of that was, that the room was in the basement and had a tiny window and when looking out of the window you were looking at a staircase. The room was quite hot and had a fan mounted up the wall and unreachable without the usage of a chair. Bathroom was clean but very small. The sink had the same size of my sink in my toilet at home. And then there was this bed. If you're slim then 2 persons can fit here, but the matras was just horrible and some spots you could feel the spring. They defo need to replace the matrasses. I would not stay again in this hotel, you can find something better, a bit further from Central London and even cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “better look somewhere else”
Reviews.Author: Alessandra_S
Reviews.Content: the hotel itself is so well located that it's easy to fall for it, but behind its doors there's not such a wonder. typical victorian stairs make it hard to get to the last floor,where my room was, with luggage. breakfast room is a tiny tiny room behind the reception, with not enough chair for all customers and no service at all, so it all ended up in a mess and a waste of money. better head off somewhere else for breakfast. when we entered the basin in our room was stuck and the following days cleaning service was not the good I expected it to be. Good if you want to be in central london, but onestly I will suggest to keep on searching for a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid Avoid Avoid - just depressing!”
Reviews.Author: Nic0l4
Reviews.Content: I booked this "hotel" as I had to stay overnight in London and like the Nottinghill area. They has classified themselves as a 3 star (based on what???). I had looked at the photos online and they seemed basic but looked ok for Â£50 for a short notice booking. The location was good but as soon as I arrived I had concerns. Before anything else I was being asked to pay and informed that my room would be small and the toilet was down stairs next to Reception. This was pointed out in the small print, clearly something I'd overlooked. When seeking clarification from the man at Reception over entering my credit card details onto their paperwork he sarcastically spelt out the word S-A-M-E ie if the card is the same you dont need to re-write it? Funny as English is my first language and I didnt appreciate the rudeness at the start of my depressing stay. I dragged my heavy suitcase up the stairs (without any offer of help) to my "room" and just couldnt believe what I'd paid for. A converted broom cupboard is the only way to describe Room 26. You can stand up and touch both sides of the wall with your hands, the bed is a small single that dips in the middle, the walls are scuffed & filthy and there is a small narrow window that opens behind your pillow. So freezing head if you fancy some fresh air. I asked for an upgrade but was told they were full and had a look in the area but couldnt find anything so resigned myself to staying in this hovel. Next morning, no hot water for a shower! Breakfast, a dismal selection of cheap white / brown bread; sliced cheese and cereal. A depressing end to a terrible stay. They said this room was originally Â£85 but on this website it was Â£49 (then they charged 4% service charge to use my card!). Do yourself a favour and just pay the extra to stay well away from this poor excuse for a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love it~!”
Reviews.Author: Siti_Amalina
Reviews.Content: Love everything about the hotel and the area they are located at. My two friends and I, we are students who were travelling around during our mid-sem break. Since it's our first time to London, we were worried about not being able to find the hotel. Following the map directions it only took us 3-5mins from Notting Hill station to the hotel. The price was reasonable enough for the three of us. Stayed there for three nights and it was a pleasant stay. The hotel is small though, but we love the interior decor. Cosy, charming and the rooms were just nice for us. For the price that we paid, the breakfast that they served were good enough for us, though I'm aware that other reviewers might not agree to this due to the area that they serve breakfast is at the reception area. During the duration of our stay, we met up to 4 different staffs, which were all so helpful and friendly! One thing good about the area is that, you don't have to worry about food. There's like KFC, Nandos, turkish food and 15mins walk to Bayswater there's a whole lot of variety! Overall in my opinion, it's worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “dirtiest place ever”
Reviews.Author: jjanesz
Reviews.Content: So many problems during our stay with my girlfriend.4% extra charge for credit card payment and paying in advance at checking in!dirty carpets,walls and curtains.hair in bed and in bathroom.continental breakfast=no fruit,salami,just jam and butter,toast!no manager around!reception doesnt want to call him at all!Complain book=sheet of paper,probably thrown away asap.my worst hotel experience ever,honestly.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible”
Reviews.Author: ChrystelSG
Reviews.Content: The first thing that chocked me when I got to the Hotel was the service. I understand if she doesn't speak English, but she has to know that you say "Hello" when you meet someone. She just gave me a piece of paper where I was to write my name. The room had not been cleaned and I thought the lamp, which was above the bed, was going to fall on my head! I know how the showers are in London but I had to wait 10mins to get hot water. And it was boiling hot. The walls where horrible, it felt like if I were in a haunted hotel.The breakfast was nasty and weirdly some of my stuff was missing! Then I decided to move to an other hotel. And when I asked for a cab she asked me to do it myself! I was not going to the nearest busy street with my heavy luggage! When the cap arrived she said I wasn't around. I was in the lounge....Unfortunately I had to go back to asked for my stuff but no one was there to help me. I have been to many hotels and I used to think that the only thing I needed was a bed. If you think like that, this is the hotel for you. Unfortunately I need more than a bed...I need hygiene and service

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Tiny box room in the attic up four flights of narrow stairs. Our bed was on casters and moved around in the night. No hot water and breakfast was terrible. All for the bargain price of Â£105. Don't bother.

Reviews.Title: “Oh dear....”
Reviews.Author: Gossa
Reviews.Content: Awful and would never go there again....but if you are: - The 4th floor is 89 steps high and there is no lift. The basement rooms are dark and dingey. The carpets in the rooms we saw/stayed in were disgusting. There is a 4% charge on all card transactions so pay cash if you can else it will could get pricey! Don't expect an english person on reception at any time of the day. Don't expect breakfast unless you want to get up stupidly early - there is a better bakery round the corner from the hotel where you can get a better breakfast. Best avoided unless you get an exceptional deal (as in less than Â£50 a night). Free Wifi though....

Reviews.Title: “I'd rather sleep in Hyde Park”
Reviews.Author: ANONANON
Reviews.Content: This hotel was so bad, it was comical. Firstly it's not a hotel; it's more like a youth hostel, and a poor one at that. Fortunately my expectations werenâ€™t high. I was staying in London for one night to go to the Kings of Leon gig in Hyde park. Most hotels were fully booked; I booked this one a couple of months in advance for Â£75. Our room was on the top floor, about 6 or 7 flights of stairs â€“ thereâ€™s no lift and the heat was unbearable. The room was like a furnace, it was a hot day in London but thereâ€™s no air con. The rooms are tiny, hardly bigger than a double bed, we had to get ready in shifts. On the plus side it was quiet and the bathroom was clean and adequate. Breakfast (tea and toast) resembled a morning at faulty towers. People were packed like sardines into a tiny office behind reception. There were no free seats so we took a tray upstairs. Although we nearly passed out by the time we got to the top. The location is very good, close to the tube stations, Portobello road and hyde park. Should you stay here? I suppose it depends how much you pay for the room and the purpose of your travel. If it's cheap and you just need a place to crash, it'll do - just don't go in the summer.

Reviews.Title: “Beware! You are worth more than this place!!!!”
Reviews.Author: timetraveller223
Reviews.Content: Our room was up 100+ stairs, top floor, no lift, extremely hot. The room was crammed with a single and a double bed. My son refused to sleep under the covers for fear of what might lurk beneath. Carpets filthy, walls filthy. Light fittings hanging off the wall. Big holes gouged out the walls too. Bathroom was tiny but better decorated than the bedroom and cleaner. I was embarrassed to take my family here. Would never use again. The price may sound inviting but come on guys, you are worth more than this place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Not the best option.”
Reviews.Author: DMariner
Reviews.Content: We've seen three rooms. Last one was great. I want to write that now that I see more photos of the hotel, it might be a good one. But we only saw the good room after we complained a lot about bein locked out in the basement. It might have been all a series of unfortunate accidents. But the thing is that we ended up in a room without a key, down in the basement (room 1), no much light from the outside and windows and door that would not keep the warmth in. After two nights we were moved to a room with carpeted floor, which was against health conditions for us (duly noted in our reservation). The fourth night we were in the good room (18, if interested, at the end of the entrance corridor). That is the big one. It has space, it hast sofa, coffee table,... Nice. We ended up having a good time. I guess it is a good place if you get a good room. Transportation connections are excellent and the neighborhood quiet and with many little shops and dining places.

Reviews.Title: “A FairyTale end to a perfect weekend.”
Reviews.Author: LuckyEric
Reviews.Content: One of the best hotels in that I have stayed. My money was used well. Room temperature was hot like sauna but meant sexy times. Morning food sustained me throughout the days. International guests : an added bonus. Double bed, big enough for four. Staff made me eager for more gentle suprises over the weekend, including boiled eggs :) We were very apologetic when the towels were wet, but they dried them very well.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for central London - but be aware of the plug socket”
Reviews.Author: Judy1965
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything we expected for Â£44 in central London. Good location, easy accces to tube and elsewhere. Bed linen, bathroom and towels crisp and clean and very good TV - however, curtains stained and you would not want to put your bare feet on the carpet ! Plug sockets are not easily accessable, when we found the socket for the hairdryer it was hanging from the wall!! I reported this, so hopefully it will be repaired?! If you are on the top floor (room 24 -25) you need to be aware that there are 7 flights of stairs, roughly 100 steps and no lift, so not good for people with mobility problems. Breakfast fine, toast, cereal, eggs ( hard boiled) and jams, with friut juices, tea and coffee - but breakfast room a little compact. The hotel suited our stay for 1 night - but room could do with a good lick of paint and electrics need sorting! Would stay here again if nothing better available.

Reviews.Title: “WARNING!!!”
Reviews.Author: kaza012
Reviews.Content: Please check when you book this hotel that your room is not described as a double on the ground floor. We booked a double ensuite, what we got was a single with a double bed in it, no room to move, a shower that was impossible. It was so hot that we had to have the window open, there was a nest of pigeons flapping and cooing all night and the family below who had no regard for guests, i had to shout at them to be quiet late at night. Pillows (one each) were rock hard. The room itself was spotlessly clean but unbearable, no storage for luggage. Breakfast was included ,a selection of a boiled egg or cereal or toast but with all guests in one 'breakfast' room the size of a shoebox, we ended up eating out. The other rooms may be fine but just be warned about the ground floor doubles.

Reviews.Title: “Tinest shower ever”
Reviews.Author: travelingpixy
Reviews.Content: Very noisy, very bare and the most uncomfortable bed ever. The only hotel I had to wear ear plugs in because I could not sleep with all the noise. The breakfast was very minimal and not worth the free price. I'm a tiny girl and I had major issues fitting into the shower and being able to turn around in it. Every day we had to ask for towels because there was never any left in our room. My mother and I laughed about it to keep in good spirits but we would never stay there again and would never recommend it to anyone. The only good thing was it was in a nice part of town and close to a tube station, so you could get away from it quickly.

Reviews.Title: “Not as described”
Reviews.Author: Asblikkie
Reviews.Content: Booked hotel based on location. Very centrally located and close to tube and bus routes. Staff was friendly, but was adamant about a 4% charge for using credit card. No mention about this on website. Also room was insanely small. No desk, no phone, no towel bars, no hangers for clothing and half of light bulbs were removed = poor lighting. TV worked, but no remote( asked for one and was supplied with one two days later). Breakfast room was very small, and made for some uncomfortable eating moments, but overall not too bad. On the whole I would say the hotel was absolutely misrepresented on the website. The rooms do not even come close to what is described or shown. For the price one would expect more. This is more comparable to youth hostel than hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: crissyukbr
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff. What you see on the website is not what you buy. The room they gave us when we arrived was a tiny and hot one in the basement, then we compalined and they gave us the nightmare room 6 which is close to the brekfast room. We could hear everything from outside and so impossible to sleep well. Then thy moved us to room 20 which was better. Bed had wheels and moved far too easily. Bathrooms are tiny. Nowhere to hang towels. Breakfast area was very very tiny. A joke... we could not move!!! Breakfast was far too simple and even the coffee was cold. We (couple) paid Â£110 pounds for 2 days. After all that was mentioned above, this price was far too expensive. Ah! They charge you if you pay by credit card and this is not mentioned on the website.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean budget hotel with a few creases to iron out”
Reviews.Author: jmel08
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on the basis of other people's reviews and the hotel's proximity to the tube station, and I was not disappointed. The hotel is in a nice little street off the main road and there are lots of shops and places to eat nearby. Notting Hill is a lovely, quirky area and I would probably stay here again as it is convenient for everything, especially the tube. In all I had a pleasant stay and would recommend it to others, but there were a few little issues, which I think it's only fair to mention. If the hotel ironed these out I think it would be a really good place to stay, as it's pretty good already, it just needs a little more attention to detail and then it would be great. The reception staff were pleasant and helpful and the room was very clean and had fairly modern decor - particularly the bathroom, which was tiled and had a reasonable sized shower. My only slight quibble with it was that there was no towel rail or a hook to hang up a towel. In fact there were no hooks in the room at all, which meant I had to drape my wet towel over the sink, which wasn't ideal, but not the end of the world. I was travelling alone but had a double room, which was quite small but suited my needs perfectly. However, I think if there had been two people in the room, or if you were staying there for more than a few nights, it would have been a bit cramped. There were only four hangers in the wardrobe section (which was really just a rail with a wooden frame around it) and the only other drawer space was in the bedside table, which was small and there was only one, so if you had a lot of luggage I think you would struggle. On the plus side, there was a desk, a flatscreen TV (but only had the standard five channels) and free wi-fi and the window opened, which was nice to get some fresh air. The breakfast was simple but pleasant - there was corn flakes, muesli, apple and orange juice, tea, coffee, toast, jam, butter and boiled eggs. The hotel has no lift and there are LOTS of stairs and nobody to help with your luggage - there is a lovely grand staircase as you go in, but it's not so lovely when you are trying to carry heavy bags up it! I was staying on the fourth floor and it was quite tricky trying to negotiate my bulky suitcase up the narrow windy stairs to my room. Also at night the lights were not working on the fourth floor and the only light came from blue fire safety lights, which looked a bit like cat's eyes, low down on the wall. I had a bit of trouble finding the key slot for my room as it was so dark. But like I said, these were only small issues and wouldn't put me off going back. I'd just try to stay in a room on a lower floor next time or bring lighter luggage!

Reviews.Title: “very small room with smiling staff but not understanding you”
Reviews.Author: gezginlady
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 2 weeks. The reason why I chose is its location, very close to the centre and tube station. The room and the bathroom are too small. The staff seemed to be helpful and smilling , but Ä±t took them 10 days to change the bed sheets and the electric light bulb in the bathroom. The continental breakfast they offer has the least variety I have ever seen. I wouldn't stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice little hotel”
Reviews.Author: jetsetting_bear
Reviews.Content: A small hotel near the Notting Hill area with only about 25 (?) rooms. We (three adults) stayed there for 5 days. We got the room on the 5th floor and there was no elevator so the trek upstairs with our three luggages was not fun. Location was very convenient - about a 3-5 min walk from Notting Hil Gate Station or the Queensway tube station. Just steps from the hotel is a bus stop, so you are only a bus ride away from places like Oxford Street and Picadilly Circus (take bus 94) and the British Museum (bus 390). It's also within walking distance to Kensington Garden and Portabello Road. Breakfast was provided in the morning but don't expect anything fancy. It was hard boiled eggs, toast with jam/butter, milk, fruit juices, coffee and tea. Breakfast room is really small, and depending on when everybody else gets up, may get a little crowded, so you may have to line up to get into the room. And even if you get sick of their breakfast there are decent places around the Notting Hill Gates tube station (ie. Pret-a-manger, EAT) just down the street. The room was a little small, but at least everything was clean. We were mostly out and about and was mainly looking for a place to crash after a long sightseeing. Staff was friendly and helpful. The street was a dead-end street so there isn't as much traffic as a main street, so it was pretty quiet at night. Our only complaint was there was no remote control in our room on our arrival and it took a while to figure out which remote control worked in our room. Overall we are satisfied with this place and would recommend this to others.

Reviews.Title: “never will stay at this hotel again!”
Reviews.Author: Single_traveller_9
Reviews.Content: Booked a single room. When I arrived, it turned out there is no toilet in this room! The administrator kept telling me, but it has a shower, like it is enough. The single room itself bears no critic. I canceled my reservation and found another hotel nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Very very nice place”
Reviews.Author: Juyane
Reviews.Content: Went there for a 4 days trip with my boy-friend. Really nice, quite hotel, unluckily at the last floor without lift, but it was worth it. Clean, quite, we were lucky: we got a 4 persons room for 2, so the room was big enough... but the guy at the reception said we were lucky as the rooms for 2 are small... The bathroom was completly new, there was a flat TV in the room, a kettle and so. Nothing to say, really nice, some restaurants around, a Tesco at 5 min walk, as far as a metro station. I highly recommend it !!

Reviews.Title: “Best place in town! ;-)”
Reviews.Author: FredeCopenhagen
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, Cheap, good service, great location!! YOU WONÂ´T WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!! Frederick ( Denmark )

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY HERE!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: me162
Reviews.Content: Rude staff who mess up your booking then call the police when you complain. Don't waste your time or money here

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for money”
Reviews.Author: Kirre99
Reviews.Content: Excellent 4 nights, paid 45 punds per night including brekfest, location is very good, rooms very clean and service good. Breakfest included bread, eggs and cerials, but that was just extra for the price we paid. Recommend to everyone!

HotelInfo.Name: Notting Hill Gate Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 7 Clanricarde Gardens, London W2 4JJ, England
